features.name: Import from Wearables and Apps
features.description: Automatically sync data from your Apple Health, Fitbit, sleep trackers, nutrition apps, and more.

features.name: Browser AI Agents
features.description: AI agents autonomously collect your dietary intake, supplement usage, and prescription data from online sources.

features.name: Manual Data Collection
features.description: Easy voice or text input for symptoms, treatments, and lifestyle factors when automated collection isn't available.

features.name: Data from Speech
features.description: Voice-based symptom reporting and health journaling with natural language processing.

features.name: Images to Data
features.description: Take photos of meals, supplements, or symptoms and AI converts them to structured data.

features.name: Notifications
features.description: Smart reminders for data collection, medication adherence, and study participation.

features.name: Automated Causal Inference
features.description: Advanced algorithms determine which factors are actually causing your symptoms vs mere correlations.

features.name: Root Cause Analysis
features.description: Identify the specific foods, supplements, medications, or lifestyle factors impacting your health.

features.name: Onset Delay Analysis
features.description: Account for the time lag between taking an action and seeing effects (e.g., supplements may take weeks to work).

features.name: Duration of Action
features.description: Understand how long effects last to optimize timing and dosing.

features.name: Cumulative Effects
features.description: Track long-term impacts and cumulative benefits or risks over time.

features.name: Automated Trial Discovery
features.description: AI matches you with relevant clinical trials based on your conditions and data.

features.name: One-Click Enrollment
features.description: Join studies with a single click - no lengthy paperwork or site visits required.

features.name: Passive Data Sharing
features.description: Your existing data streams automatically contribute to research once you opt in.

features.name: Citizen Science
features.description: Anyone can create and run their own studies to test hypotheses about health interventions.

features.name: Open Publication
features.description: All results published in 'Clinipedia' - a Wikipedia for clinical research findings.

features.name: Real-world Evidence
features.description: Studies use real-world data from daily life, not just controlled lab settings.
